sentences.sContent: What do a hummingbird, a moth, and a maple tree have in common?
sentences.sContent_eng: What do a hummingbird, a moth, and a maple tree have in common?
sentences.sCn: 蜂鸟、蛾子和枫树之间有什么共同之处呢？

sentences.sContent: As I looked at the dead moth, this minute wayside triumph of so great a force over so mean an antagonist filled me with wonder.
sentences.sContent_eng: As I looked at the dead moth, this minute wayside triumph of so great a force over so mean an antagonist filled me with wonder.
sentences.sCn: 我看着这只死飞蛾，想着如此强大的力量打败如此卑微的敌手，而取得如此微末的不上道的胜利，我不由惊愕不已。

sentences.sContent: Trajectory analysis also indicates that there are only fewer outbreaks of meadow moth in northeast part can be traced back to northern China.
sentences.sContent_eng: Trajectory analysis also indicates that there are only fewer outbreaks of meadow moth in northeast part can be traced back to northern China.
sentences.sCn: 轨迹分析结果显示，东北地区草地螟蛾峰只有少数可以回推至以往认为的主要越冬区。

remMethod.val: “莫死” → 不畏死 → 飞蛾扑火不畏死 → 蛾

trans.tranOther: an insect related to the  butterfly  that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.
